marklogic.body:
Firstly, you're talking about different contexts: I have no difficulty with Santorum or anyone influencing a bunch of nutbar fundy yell coaches to endorse him - the entire process of endorsements is bogus to start with & probably doesn't work except with the weakest of minds. I DO have SOME problems with ballot box stuffing in a primary (tho a lot more in the general, where it really matters) - but Iowa wasn't a true vote ballot box context - it was a caucus, & caucuses are open discussion plus some voting processes which don't involve the ballot to any critical extent (It's optional at most, & where used, mostly pointless.), but besides all that it's a PRIMARY. Â
There is absolutely no problem at all with the Kochies & of a few banksters getting together at a vacation Spot in the Bahamas & picking their very own nominee for the Rs - which is the same things that they've BEEN doing in every presidential election cycle since the Civil War ended, with a few notable exceptions - or one anyway: 1964). Where the Secret ballot democratic process matters is in the general, & ONLY in the general. If you cons want to go thru some Kabuki exercise in fake intraparty democracy every four years, go ahead - you're only fooling yourselves.
